trans-unit.source: Enumerates credential types the client can authenticate with when security is enabled in the `BasicHttpBinding` binding.
If <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpSecurity.Mode%2A> is configured to perform client authentication at the message level, this enumeration controls the client credential type.

Both username and X.509 certificate to use must be provisioned through an <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior> instance which implements the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityCredentialsManager> extensibility point; in a common default case this is <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials>.

The client credential in the certificate case must be specified using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials.ClientCertificate%2A> property of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> class.

The client credential in the username case must be specified using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials.UserName%2A> property of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> class.
In addition, when message security mode is used, the client must be provisioned with the service's certificate.

The service credential in this case must be specified using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials.ServiceCertificate%2A> property on the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> class.
Indicates that a client be authenticated using a certificate.
Indicates that the client be authenticated using a username credential.
